zone.line: in the same proportion as its forms survived
in the unreformed worship of modern Europe.
The one preceded & the other followed, the
Reformation at almost equal intervals.
Dante was the first religious reformer, &
Luther surpassed him rather in the
rudeness & acrimony than in the boldness
-ness of his censures of papal usurpation.
Dante was the first awakener of
entransed Europe; he created a language
in itself music & persuasion out of
a chaos of inharmonious barbarisms,
he was the leader congregator of those
great spirits who bu presided over the
resurrection of learning; the Lucifer
of that starry flock which in the
13th century shone forth from republican
-lican Italy as from a heaven into the
darkness of the benighted world. His
very words are instinct with spirit,
each is as a spark, a burning atom
of inextinguishable thought —- and
